channel.title: Gaming "Programs"
channel.description: So.. I've seen these sort of programs that are called "Gaming Programs" where apparently they turn the computer into a gaming computer or something, what does these programs actually do and do they even work?

item.title: Gaming "Programs"
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

Ah thats good, you may benefit from advanced system care 5. Personally I really like it, its made my PC run a fair bit faster. Its made by iobit aswell ( the makers of gamebooster).

I’ll take a look at it, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming "Programs"
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:7, topic:447749”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=550637.msg4036204#msg4036204 date=1341233134]
Thats probably the best one thats free atm. Tbh I wouldn’t expect it to make a big difference for you as I’m assuming you already check your processes etc. Its more meant for people that don’t. Lin should have said paused rather than stops, as you can re-enable the processes again.
[/quote]
Yeah, I downloaded the BETA of this program and it seems to be working well enough, it doesn’t work for the game I wanted it to work for but I’m not surprised assuming this game has MANY textures, NPCs in one place etc., other than that, the other games I’ve used this on seems to be working a lot better than they use to… :|[/quote]
Ah thats good, you may benefit from advanced system care 5. Personally I really like it, its made my PC run a fair bit faster. Its made by iobit aswell ( the makers of gamebooster).

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming "Programs"
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

Thats probably the best one thats free atm. Tbh I wouldn’t expect it to make a big difference for you as I’m assuming you already check your processes etc. Its more meant for people that don’t. Lin should have said paused rather than stops, as you can re-enable the processes again.

Yeah, I downloaded the BETA of this program and it seems to be working well enough, it doesn’t work for the game I wanted it to work for but I’m not surprised assuming this game has MANY textures, NPCs in one place etc., other than that, the other games I’ve used this on seems to be working a lot better than they use to…

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming "Programs"
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Thats probably the best one thats free atm. Tbh I wouldn’t expect it to make a big difference for you as I’m assuming you already check your processes etc. Its more meant for people that don’t. Lin should have said paused rather than stops, as you can re-enable the processes again.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming "Programs"
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Lin:

Programs like GameBooster? They stop all unnecessary applications and services (basically processes), freeing up the used resources for gaming.

Suppose I’ll be trying this one out.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Lin:

Programs like GameBooster? They stop all unnecessary applications and services (basically processes), freeing up the used resources for gaming.

t4:

sort of pointless on modern gaming machines

Nothing else to be said about them tbh that the above two statements.
